article.description:
Richard Hamilton scored 22 points in
his Pistons debut and Detroit's depth wore down the injury-depleted
New York Knicks in an 86-77 victory Wednesday night.

related.description: The New York Knicks signed Lee Nailon on Wednesday, adding the forward to their injury-depleted roster.
related.linkText: Knicks sign ex-Hornet Nailon to address injury void
related.title: Knicks sign former Hornets forward Nailon
related.headline: Knicks sign former Hornets forward Nailon

article.headline: Hamilton, Atkins fuel Pistons over Knicks
article.linkText: Dismal shooting leads to Knicks' loss to Pistons
article.story:
AUBURN HILLS, Mich. (AP) -- Richard Hamilton and Chauncey Billups had awkward debuts for the Detroit Pistons, leading the team in scoring despite sitting out the fourth quarter.
Hamilton

Detroit's depth wore down the injury-depleted New York Knicks in an 86-77 victory Wednesday night. Hamilton scored 22 and Billups added 16, but they watched Jon Barry and Chucky Atkins play in their places at shooting and point guard in the final quarter. "It was definitely weird not playing in the fourth,'' said Hamilton, acquired for Jerry Stackhouse. "But I just want to win games.'' That's the attitude Detroit coach Rick Carlisle is counting on. "This is who we are, we're a team of components of good people that play hard,'' Carlisle said. "Decisions on who plays down the stretch are going to be gut-wrenching some nights, but I think everybody in the locker room is pulling for one thing and that's winning.'' Allan Houston scored 31 and helped New York lead by as many as 12 in the first half, but he didn't have much help with Latrell Sprewell out with a broken hand and Antonio McDyess sidelined for the season with a knee injury. "We had a great opportunity and we let it slip,'' Houston said. "We shouldn't have lost a game where we played this well. We pretty much have to take every opportunity that we get.'' Detroit scored 15 straight points midway through the fourth -- capped by three straight 3-pointers by Atkins -- to take a 77-68 lead and control of the game for good. The Knicks missed 13 straight shots in the midst of Detroit's run, and Houston was just 1-of-8 in the final quarter. "I thought we fought hard enough to win,'' New York coach Don Chaney said. "We just couldn't hit the shots.'' Atkins scored 12 and Corliss Williamson had 10 off the bench as part of Detroit's 10-man rotation. "Depth wins ballgames in the NBA,'' Atkins said. "We can put our first five out there to wear teams down and our bench can go out there and keep the pressure on.'' New York's Kurt Thomas scored 17 and Othella Harrington added 10. The Pistons raised their Central Division championship banner before the game. It's their first since 1990, the second year of their consecutive NBA titles. Houston then scored from all over the court -- against three different defenders -- and drew two fouls on both Michael Curry and Hamilton in the first quarter. But Houston was called for his second foul in the final minute of the first and his third midway through the second quarter. The Pistons took advantage of having Houston on the bench. They went on a 11-2 run late in the first half to cut their deficit to 43-40 before trailing by five at halftime. After the Pistons cut their deficit to one for a fourth time in the third quarter, the Knicks scored six straight. New York led 65-60 entering the fourth. Game notes
With the addition of small forward Lee Nailon, who the Knicks signed Thursday, Sprewell said it doesn't make the trade rumors regarding him any better. "I think it's a little fuel,'' Sprewell said. Nailon will join the Knicks in Philadelphia for their next game. ... Detroit's Ben Wallace had 14 rebounds and two blocks after leading the NBA in both categories last season. ... The Pistons signed Billups as a free agent after his breakthrough season with Minnesota last season. ... New York's Michael Doleac, who did not play in the preseason, missed the game with a hamstring injury and said he's day-to-day.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
